newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Earthquake jolts Bangladesh, some damage reported.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake jolts Bangladesh, some damage reported.

text.p: An earthquake jolted Bangladesh on Thursday, causing some damage to older buildings but no casualties, government officials and eyewitnesses said.
A tremor of "moderate intensity" was felt in most parts of Bangladesh at 0854 a.m (0254 GMT) and lasted 30 seconds, said meteorological department director Sajedur Rahman.
He said the epicentre of the earthquake was located 326 km (195 miles) north of the southeastern port city of Chittagong.
Hong Kong's Royal Observatory estimated the magnitude of the earthquake at 5.7 on the Richter scale.
Residents in the eastern town of Sylhet, about 300 km (180 miles) north of Chittagong, said some old buildings had been damaged by the tremor. But there were no reports of any casualties.
In Dhaka, residents in the old part of the city rushed out of their houses in panic.
